content: ज्ञानं [ज्ञा-भावे ल्युट्] {@--1@} Knowing, understanding, becoming acquainted with, proficiency; सांख्यस्य योगस्य च ज्ञानं <ls>Māl. 1. 7.</ls> {@--2@} Knowledge, learning; बुद्धिर्ज्ञानेन शुध्यति <ls>Ms. 5. 109</ls>; ज्ञाने मौनं क्षमा शत्रौ <ls>R. 1. 22.</ls> {@--3@} Consciousness, cognizance, knowledge; ज्ञानतोऽज्ञानतो वापि <ls>Ms. 8. 288.</ls> knowingly or unknowingly, consciously or unconsciously. {@--4@} Sacred knowledge; especially, knowledge derived from meditation on the higher truths of religion and philosophy which teaches man how to understand his own nature and how he may be reunited to the Supreme spirit (<ab>opp.</ab> कर्मन्); <ab>cf.</ab> ज्ञानयोग and कर्मयोग in <ls>Bg. 3. 3.</ls> {@--5@} The organ of intelligence, sense, intellect. {@--6@} Conscience. {@--7@} The Supreme spirit. {@--8@} An epithet of Viṣṇu. {@--9@} The Vedās taken collectively.
